title: It's time for The Big Food Redesign Challenge! - ellenmacarthurfoundation.org
summary: The Big Food Redesign Challenge aims to transform the food system by encouraging producers, brands, and suppliers to apply Circular Design for Food principles, creating products that regenerate nature. Participants will design or redesign food products with criteria assessments, including access to the HowGood Latis Platform. Successful ideas will be invited to production, with support from Waitrose and John Lewis Partnership. The initiative is funded by the People’s Postcode Lottery and the Schmidt Family Foundation.

title: UN offers 'roadmap' to reducing plastic pollution by 80% by 2040 - Fox Weather
summary: The UN Environment Programme's report outlines a roadmap for reducing plastic pollution by 80% by 2040 through market shifts towards a circular economy, including promoting reuse, enhancing recycling, and replacing plastic with alternative materials. The report emphasizes urgent action to prevent an increase in plastic pollution.

title: May 2 - Ecology seeks comments on rule for recycled content in plastic packaging - Washington State Department of Ecology
summary: The Washington Department of Ecology is seeking public comments on a proposed rule to implement recycled content requirements under the 2021 Plastics Law, which aims to reduce new plastic production by mandating producers to include a minimum amount of post-consumer recycled content (PCRC) in trash bags and plastic packaging. The public review period ends on July 1, 2023, with online hearings scheduled for June 8 and 15, 2023. The law is designed to mitigate plastic pollution and associated environmental impacts over time by increasing minimum PCRC requirements for various product categories, significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions compared to virgin materials. The finalized rule will take effect on January 1, 2024.
green_innovation: TRUE: The proposed rule implements the 2021 Plastics Law, which aims to increase post-consumer recycled content in plastic products, thereby contributing to environmental sustainability and reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE: The introduction of recycled content requirements represents a significant improvement in manufacturing practices for plastic products, differing from previous product processes by incorporating sustainability measures in production.
green_product: FALSE: While the article discusses requirements for products, it does not specifically identify a green product that meets the definition provided.
green_process: TRUE: The proposed requirements for utilizing post-consumer recycled content in manufacturing processes represent a method that minimizes environmental impact and promotes sustainability.

title: This new service is the first-of-its-kind online thrift store for sneakers — and the savings on top brands are tremendous - The Cool Down
summary: SneakerCycle is an ecommerce site dedicated to selling gently-used and refurbished sneakers, aiming to make sneaker culture more affordable and sustainable. Founded by Steven Salstein and Eric Mesa, the company emphasizes sustainability by extending the life cycle of sneakers, reducing waste, and promoting recycling through its initial partner program, GotSneakers. The sneakers are thoroughly cleaned and disinfected before being sold, and the company seeks to lessen the environmental impact of sneaker production and disposal.

title: Regulation needed to advance circular economy - Waste Management Review
summary: The article discusses the challenges faced by the recycling industry in Australia, emphasizing the need for a cohesive regulatory framework and support for recycling to promote a circular economy. It highlights issues such as the fragmented regulatory environment, the necessity for a nationally consistent definition of end-of-waste, and the importance of developing strong end markets for recycled materials. The article advocates for legislative measures like minimum recycled content in packaging and collaboration between governments and industry to enhance recycling practices and overall recycling system resilience.

title: Good News – Your Breakfast Cereal Should Stop Killing The Planet By 2050 - Yahoo Canada Sports
summary: Nestlé aims to make its breakfast cereals more eco-friendly by 2050, announcing plans to halve greenhouse gas emissions by 2030. The company intends to focus on regenerative agriculture, sourcing sustainable ingredients, and using 100% recycled packaging by 2025. Nestlé acknowledges the environmental impact of its current practices, including the use of toxic chemicals and deforestation. The initiative aims to enhance local biodiversity and reduce reliance on conventional agri-chemicals.

title: 12 May: Earth Overshoot Day - Endesa
summary: Spain's Country Overshoot Day fell on May 12, 2023, marking the day when the planet's renewable resources for the year are fully consumed. This date has been shifting earlier over the years since 1971, reflecting unsustainable economic practices that exceed the earth's biocapacity. Human activities such as greenhouse gas emissions from fossil fuel use, deforestation, and over-exploitation of agriculture contribute to this issue, indicating an urgent need for change in consumption patterns.

title: The future of the European textile industry is now - The Brussels Times
summary: The article discusses the EU Strategy for Sustainable & Circular Textiles, aimed at reducing the environmental impact of the textile industry while enhancing its competitiveness. title: VIC Gov introduces new glass recycling bins - Council - Council Magazine
summary: The Victorian Government is implementing a new four-stream recycling system with purple-lidded bins for glass recycling across the state. This initiative, aimed at enhancing recycling capacity and reducing landfill waste, is expected to create new jobs and significantly lower emissions by 2030. The government has invested $129 million to support this transition and to boost the circular economy in Victoria. The new Container Deposit Scheme starting in November 2023 will facilitate glass recycling both at home and in the community.

title: Parry & Evans steps up recycling efforts with new Deeside facility - Deeside.com
summary: Parry & Evans has opened a new plastic recycling facility in Deeside, Wales, contributing to enhanced recycling efforts in the region. The facility processes various grades of plastics into flakes and pellets for new products, aligning with the company's commitment to the circular economy. Local officials commend this initiative as a significant step towards mitigating the climate crisis through improved recycling capabilities. The development highlights the increasing focus on sustainable practices within the UK recycling sector.

title: Union Minister Hardeep S Puri launches mega campaign 'Meri LiFE, Mera Swachh Shehar'. - Etemaad
summary: Minister for Housing and Urban Affairs Hardeep S Puri launched the ‘Meri LiFE, Mera Swachh Shehar’ campaign to promote the Reduce, Reuse, and Recycle (RRR) concept of waste management in New Delhi. The campaign will establish RRR Centres nationwide for citizens to deposit used items such as clothes and plastic for recycling or reuse. It aims to strengthen the collective action for environmental protection and culminates on World Environment Day with a Pledge for LiFE and cleanliness drives.
